sourceDesc.p: Initially created on Tuesday 26th March 2013 by the form at http://www.tei-c.org.uk/Roma/.

revisionDesc.change: Additions repsecting the documentation part of the ODD.
Addtion of values for @ident of elementSpec for the annotations in the document. Changing the version number system: change from 0.2 to full counts.
Addition of attribute role value "transcription" for author.

div.head: Basic concepts
div.p: This TEI customization is based on several concepts and models developed by the LAUDATIO project in cooperation with the SFB 632 D1 and SaltNPepper Project. This customization refers to the corpus-linguistic meta model of a corpus and its components, see figure 1 below.

A corpus contains one or more documents. Two or more corpora built a super corpus. Documents are texts which are corpus-linguistically prepared. A text may be a whole publication such as novels or extracts from such publications. The concept 'document' contains a set of annotations. Each annotation regardless of the type can be modeled as key-value-pair. Hence, annotations consitute documents, documents constitute corpora, corpora constitute super corpora.

figure.head: Corpus concept
figure.figDesc: The figure represents a model of the corpus.

div.p: For further information and examples see Odebrecht, Carolin, Krause, Thomas (2013) Metadata in an Infrastructure for Historical Corpora. SFB 732 Incremental Specification in Context. Kolloquium.Stuttgart 20.06.2013.

div.head: Technical realization of the meta model
div.p: The LAUDATIO customization creates TEI schema for the LAUDATIO metadata concepts 'Corpus', 'Document' and 'PreparationStep' by mapping the meta model and TEI p5 header structure. The meta model is realized with TEI p5 by using one TEI header for each concept:
Each concept contains fileDesc, encodingDesc and revisionDesc. The concepts 'Corpus' and 'Document' contain profileDesc because they refer to language used in the data.

The header have correspondences to each other in the following way: The 'Corpus Header' provides lists of documents corresponding to the 'Document Header' and list of annotation made for the corpus corresponding to the 'PreparationStep Header'. Each 'Document Header' contains a list of annotation for each document in the corpus corresponding to the 'PreparationStep Header'.

div.head: TEI p5 customization for the concept 'PreparationStep'
div.p: The schema combines the four basic modules (textstructure, core, header and namesdates), but removes most of the available elements and changes several attribute classes, e.g. add an TEI attribute to another element. Thus, the customization is very restricted and allows little variation in selecting elements and attributes.

div.head: Core structure
div.p: The core module is very restricted and only contains the elements corresponding to bibliographic metadata such as author,editor, date and title and more general structural element such as list, item, label, p and ref.

No class or general module modification were made. The TEI schema is only locally restricted. That means that no inheritance relations or module relations were changed, deleted or added. The customization is documented in the section 'Formal declaration'.

All encoded metadata refer to information addressing the whole corpus, e.g. the editors and annotators of the corpus, the preliminary annotations guidelines used for all formats of the corpus, the revision history and the available formats and its license.

div.head: Basic TEI header structure
div.p: LAUDATIO metadata schema for the concept 'PreparationStep' contains much more elements and modules comparing to standard TEI header which are usually used for the purpose of text encoding only. For validity, fileDesc, encodingDesc and revisionDesc are required.

The fileDesc contains the following elements where the basic meaning are left untouched but are referred to the concept 'Document', meaning the element author refers to the annotator of the annotation, the element title refers to the title of the annotation. Elements used within teiHeader are:

The titleStmt contains the title, editors, annotators and technical stuff (infrastructure) of the annotation with the declaration forname, surname and affiliation.
...
... ...
... ...

The extent provides information about the size of the annoation. The attribute type defines the counting unit, 'tokens' or 'words'.
...

Annotations are published with a certain version of a corpus. The publicationStmt refers here only to the publication date and the corpus.
...

sourceDesc contains references to the primary texts such as scans of the facsimile.
...

encodingDesc provides information how and with which tools annotation were made, what kind of segmentation and corrections were applied.
...
...
...
...
...
...

revisionDesc refers to the version history of the annotation. Corpora in the LAUDATIO-Repository may have several versions. The changes between these versions will be provided here with focus on the annotation.
... ...

div.head: Detailed TEI header structure
div.p:
A full TEI structure with all required elements is given below:
...
... ...
... ...
...
...
...
...
...
...
...
...
...
... ...

moduleRef.include: author editor date list item label p ref title

appInfo application authority availability change correction editorialDecl encodingDesc extent fileDesc idno langUsage language namespace normalization profileDesc projectDesc publicationStmt revisionDesc segmentation sourceDesc tagUsage tagsDecl teiHeader titleStmt

attDef.gloss: You must indicate what type of extent you refere of

valItem.gloss: The size of the corpus is given in token.
The size of the corpus is given in words.

attDef.gloss: You must identify the module of the LAUDATIO metada schema, e.g. CorpusHeader, DocumentHeader, PreparationHeader

attDef.desc: List of documents in the corpus with corresponding references.
